titles.title: Dissolved sulfate concentration in marine sediment from Site NGHP-01-14A (Indian National Gas Hydrate Program Expedition)

descriptions.description: Results of the Indian National Gas Hydrate Program Expedition. In 2008, an international partnership led by the Directorate General of Hydrocarbons (DGH) under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (Government of India) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) released the results of the most complex and comprehensive gas hydrate field venture yet conducted. We present here the dissolved sulfate concentration data for one of the sites (NGHP-01-14A) cored in the Krishna-Godavari basin.

Related publications: Evan A. Solomon, Arthur J. Spivack, Miriam Kastner, Marta E. Torres and Gretchen Robertson (2014), Gas hydrate distribution and carbon sequestration through coupled microbial methanogenesis and silicate weathering in the Krishna-Godavari Basin, offshore India, Marine and Petroleum Geology 58: 233-255.
